stepAnswer: The populations from which the two samples are drawn are normally distributed.
stepTitle: Name one assumption that must be true.
choices: The populations from which the two samples are drawn are normally distributed.
At least one of the populations from which the two samples are drawn have an $$n$$ population greater than or equal to $$29$$.
One of the group statistics aren't equal to each other.
The two populations being tested are dependent upon one another.
